title: Bad communications
body: Waited nearly 2 hrs outside Follaton House on Sat along with about 10 others some in wheelchairs for third Covid vacc. Nobody turned up so we all went home. The advice on website tells u to ring 111 or NHS both of wich are useless as they said Cornwall was the nearest place to my postcode! Also had no knowledge of Follerton house as avacc centre. Not having much luck getting a third jab. Also primary 3 vacc and booster confusion to most people

title: Amazing
body: I went to A and E with broken bone in my hand, i was seen very quickly, minor trauma unit looked after me very well, then i went for surgery next morning, i was a bit nervous, it was first time in my life having an operation, i did not know what to expect. Big big thank you to the surgeon who put my bone together and everyone helping him. Then i stayed in may hill ward, again, fantastic people working there, doctors and nurses, so friendly and helpful. Overall experience is great, i know i received the best service, i cant ask for more. Many many thanks to doctors and nurses who looked after me. Gloucester Royal is the best. Thank you

author: RepeatHistory
title: Reaction to covid vaccine
body:
I had covid vaccine a few days ago, and had quite a bad reaction for longer than usual. I spoke to a private GP first, who advised me to go to A&E, but as I felt too unwell for the journey I decided to phone 111 to see if I absolutely had to or not.  
It was arranged for a paramedic clinician to call me back, and this brilliant lady was on the phone to me for 40 minutes, checking all my symptoms etc. I was extremely reluctant to go to A&E as my local hospital has no understanding of my health condition, and they always throw me out at the soonest opportunity, but this kind paramedic was insistent that my reaction was a very rare occurrence that did need urgent care. She also said I should go straight to A&E, so my husband took me, & we spent the night there. As I needed to be in a wheelchair, they did at least let him in too.  
I had various tests, & then saw an A&E doctor. She asked why we were there, and asked what long covid is, she told me I wasn't having a bad reaction to the vaccine, it must be something else. I wish the lovely paramedic I'd spoken to at home had been there at that moment, she would have been furious with that doctor. The same old story - no one wants to take any responsibility for anything. She said my dizziness was likely to be because of drinking alcohol - I don't drink alcohol as I can't tolerate it, but she appeared totally convinced that's what the problem was. There was absolutely no attempt to do anything to try and relieve any symptoms - I do not understand how this hospital operates safely. I asked for morphine as my pain levels were very high, but she wouldn't give me any (even to get home on) because morphine isn't for dizziness. I said I needed it for the pain, but she said I hadn't presented with pain - I said that actually I had, so please could she give me some, but she was completely unmoved.  
There was absolutely no way I could communicate with the 'robots' at this hospital's A&E department, they barely acted human, without trying to sound rude. I am yet again just a number, and I got no help whatsoever, in fact it made all my symptoms worse - as per the norm. It always seems to be my fault that I'm there. Last time I went there I vowed never to go back - now I know why I made that vow. How can the place be safe? I found it in no way fit for purpose. How can you run an A&E department with doctors who demonstrated to me so little medical knowledge? It is beyond me to even begin to understand it, and it is pretty frightening. If that's all the care every patient gets then I am appalled beyond words.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: funnyfc88
title: Tongue tie in Glasgow.
body: I have just read a post on here from a grandmother who's grandchild was not offered a frenotomy despite a tongue tie as he was not breastfed. My daughter is almost 10 weeks and I am still waiting for a referral. She can't latch unless using a breast shield, she splutters, dribbles chokes and coughs her way through feeds. She can't get enough through this way and eventually breaks down in tears and I have to give her a bottle of expressed breast milk. I have to pump regularly thought out the day and night. I have found the whole experience and care incredibly disappointing.

title: Post-surgical care on 5 North West Ward
body: I was extremely impressed with the care and attention I received between 14 and 20 September following my open heart surgery.  All the Ward staff were polite and attentive and I was very impressed with their professionalism during my stay.

title: Excellent supportive, efficient care
body: Throughout the pandemic the surgery has offered first class, efficient care. From reception, to nurses to the doctors I have received excellent care. I have also found Econsult to work well resulting in successful treatment. The same with a telephone  consultation I recently had. Thank you Mather Avenue Surgery.

title: receptionist
body: After an awful receptionist Tuesday night,what a diffrence Sunday..this receptionist was lovely,professional,kind,understanding and a credit to the clinic!!

title: Excellent surgery
body:
My elderly mum registered with Ship Street Surgery a few years' ago. She has always been treated with care, kindness and dignity by all the staff from the reception team to the GPs.
Her health declined during the Covid-19 pandemic, but the surgery continued to provide outstanding care and support. 
We never had problems contacting the surgery and we knew that whether we left a message with the reception team or by email, it would be picked up and dealt with and we would receive an appropriate response within a reasonable timeframe. 
This has been immensely reassuring as mum has become more frail in recent months. Dr Gracia, in particular, has been very helpful and kind in always ensuring that he talks to me as well as to mum and has patiently answered my many questions. 
We wouldn't hesitate to recommend Ship Street Surgery and we thank all the staff working there for their support over the years.

title: Fast and efficient
body: Went for a flu jab. Appointment at 12 noon, arrived 10 minutes early, back in my car at 12.02. Thanks to all

title: Great service
body: I am extremely satisfied with the services I received from the stuff.Friendly and taking care nicely and gently of all the required tests been made to me regarding chest pain .Apart from the longer amount of time waiting for the blood test results I highly recommend Dorchedter emergency department

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Broken appointment system
body: Repeatedly rang, some morning 150+ times, impossible to get past an engaged tone, after several days I went to the surgery to be confronted with posters stating you are not allowed in without a prior appointment. I entered as I was completely out of options. I was given my online login details, I finally confirmed  a telephone appointment with a nurse, the time on the online system stated 9am-9.30am. I received a call from the nurse at 8.40am which I missed, I expected a call back during the correct slot which I did not receive, tried to call surgery back all day and had nothing but an engaged ring tone. This system is simply not working and requires review.

title: Brilliant Service
body:
I am shocked to read some of the reviews for this practice. Whilst I acknowledge that these are challenging times, patient capacity has increased and phone lines are often busy, it is also one of the best GP practices that I have been registered with. 
Having spoken to patient advisors, I cannot believe the amount of abuse, intolerant and aggressive behaviour that staff have to tolerate on a daily basis. I wouldn't want that job. Anyone who works within a specialised unit, would understand that each group of people have their roles, so to say that people are chatting away while others struggle to answer the phones and receive patients is ridiculous. We appear to live in a blame society, where it is easy to put our frustrations onto others, because we want what we want, now and nothing else matters. I think it's easy to expect more of others than we offer ourselves. For example, if I had a problem I would initially see my local pharmacist and sort it out myself if I can. My GP, is my last resort and I wouldn't want to take away someone's serious problems by taking up patient advisors time and the phone lines, unless there was a serious issue. And, I can safely say, that under no circumstances, would I treat people who are only doing their job, with such disdain and contempt.

title: Really bad practice
body: Can never get an appointment, phoned Tulasi 3 medical practices at 0800hrs, 2 of them at 0801hrs said on their recorded message, 'Appointments are all fully booked' the other said to 'Call back as all lines are busy'!! The practice is taking advantage of 111 and GP hub and not providing a service themselves, the 'Covid Excuse' is wearing thin now and they should be named and shamed as this has been going on for far too long now 🤬🤬🤬

title: not the same
body: took my son in to see doctor was a locum gp I think said it was a viral infection next day back up walk in centre kid got bad tonsilitis. Doctor didn't even check him he is 3 just listen to his chest and sent us on way. same with my other son doctor prescribed antibiotics over phone as per usual had to get seen in end as son had a massive infection and they don't see you. just prescribe antibiotics all the time. nothing else. face to face appointments need to come back. we have to live as normal. government saying gps have to see patients that doesn't happen no more.

title: Never get appointment
body: Whenever call to this receptionist always saying no appointment, its all fully booked, if I call 8am. I don't understand how is possible. I always praying I have to healthy all the time, because if I sick or kids sick can't get appointment. GP are good and helpful but very very very hard to book an appointment.

title: Poor booking
body: Tried on a number of occasions to contact surgery for a Dr appointment, continue, the reception in busy. Tried from 8:29 - 8:38 this morning, with no success. Very poor.

author: sagittasg6
title: I felt alienated
body: Prior to my first midwife appointment, I was feeling nervous but excited. I did not anticipate experiencing such an excruciatingly low level of professionalism. The midwife refused to wear gloves when taking blood, butchered the blood collection and left me with blood down my arm and on my legs. Their attitude felt coercive - I felt alienated and judged the moment I stated I have family with autism, that my partner isn’t British and that I experienced and received treatment for depression years back. I felt coerced into rationalising why I was depressed and into detailing this as stemming from a rape years back. I never wish to return to this place again.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Clearly not for men
body: I was referred to Talk Plus by my GP after a breakdown earlier in the year. I had found myself in and out of the A&E a couple of times and sadly I got passed from pillar to post by the NHS. It just seemed that every where I went had no sympathy whatsoever for me. Talk Plus was no different. I found that when I spoke to them they was hearing something different to what I was saying. When I tried to clarify they would still be incapable of understanding. I just felt that while I was being mistreated I could see rooms full of women getting all the help they needed and this is so unfair. I feel that they shut the door on me knowing how fragile I am. I feel that they do not care and could not care should something happen to me, and it probably will. They just seemed to go through the motions and had no intention helping me. There is no where else to go so God knows what happens now.

author: Aunty Betty
title: Cataract treatment
body:
Why are things so disjointed in the NHS system? My mother is 85 years of age and needed a cataract operation at Stoke Mandeville and lives 1 hour away by car and 2 & 1/2 by bus. She was made to travel 2 days before op to have covid test when there is a station just up the road, travelling with people she normally wouldn't be with.  
Then for the operation she was told she would be top of list when in fact she was last. This caused immense anxiety when she knew I was waiting for over 4 hours to take her home. Plus she was around people for extended period which she normally wouldn't have been in contact with, so by the time she was finally seen she was in a real state.  
What I would really like to know if you are trying to keep patients safe, do you insist that they are have the same appointment time and therefore are in the same area? She was told to isolate 10 days prior to operation yet was made to be around strangers for 4 hours. Then I had to spend the night with her to make sure she was ok. This makes little sense. Thankfully the reception staff were lovely to her.

author: Crazydoglady28
title: Contraception query
body: The nurse I spoke to was so professional and helpful and I couldn't fault the information/help I recieved.

author: markmark0858
title: Knowledgeable and dedicated team
body:
My sister was admitted to A&E, due to her having stopped eating. She had a stroke 1 year ago.  
The team at the NRC at Edgware have managed to get her back to her baseline, from which she can progress with her rehabilitation.  
They did an outstanding job of briefing myself and my sister's new carers, including a 1 hour video link session with the neuropsychologist, followed by an appearance by each member of her team at the hospital explaining in detail how best to manage the problems she was experiencing.  
Many thanks to a caring, knowledgeable and dedicated team!

author: Katmac753
title: Attentive to my needs
body:
Presented at local pharmacy with severe abdominal pain, staff contacted my GP and they suggested I attend the Emergency Department at Crosshouse. The pharmacy assistant went above and beyond her role and took me to the hospital in her car. She then arranged for staff to transfer me from the car to the department.  
Following initial assessments and a CT scan I was diagnosed with kidney stones. Pain management took a while but all staff were very accommodating and attentive to my needs before discharging me to manage the pain at home. Special mentions to Caroline and Dave for their incredible caring qualities and leadership skills. Thank you again to all the Emergency Department staff, very grateful.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: horologiumsf77
title: Excellent care provided by all
body: I had a car accident was transferred to ED via ambulance. It was all a daze and I can’t remember much. I was then moved to Trauma and the staff are brilliant. They are all so kind and helpful. I am in a side room and I feel like royalty. The ward is cleaner than a hotel. My experience so far has been excellent and I can’t find any fault in the hospital or the staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: volansdw88
title: The procedure went smoothly
body:
I had previously visited 1B for a colposcopy and biopsy following a smear test that showed high grade cell changes. About a month later I recieved a letter saying I needed to go for a further colposcopy and procedure. Being a nurse I knew this meant I would probably have to have a LLETZ (or a loop excision biopsy).  
After a couple of weeks (and a few tears shed), my appointment had arrived. I was very nervous, a couple of years ago I had been through a similar process but didn't require any follow ups after the biopsy as they weren't concerned. I was met by a nurse who made me feel completely at ease. She introduced me to the Gynaecology Consultant Mr Mohanty who explained the procedure in full and gave me confidence in him and his team. The procedure went smoothly, I was quite tearful and anxious but the nurse and healthcare support worker were amazing, they kept me calm and distracted me while the procedure was carried out.It is never nice being on the other side of your job, but I feel my experience was made so much better by the staff involved, and they're all a credit to the NHS.

author: junegt96
title: No communication with staff members
body: I came to ED due to chest pain that appeared to worsen throughout the day. I waited in the ED waiting area for nearly 12 hours before being seen. This is relatively traumatic and daunting as there is no communication with staff members to patients in the waiting area. I really felt like just a number waiting to be called instead of a human being. The seating area is very uncomfortable which does not help whilst waiting hours to be seen. Once I got into the A&E nursing area I had to wait a few hours for bloods, x-ray and ECG. I don’t understand why this is not completed in triage. I was then moved to ambulatory, I am exhausted but I have been well looked after. All the staff in ED and Ambulatory are brilliant but more money needs to be spent in ED to improve wait times and allow more hospitals to open an ED service so it's more localized.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: HonestL21
title: Medical termination of pregnancy
body:
I opted to attend hospital for my medical termination of pregnancy due to a previous ectopic pregnancy and anxiety surrounding the potential pain I would endure at home. I was reassured by a member of the sexual health team that in the ward, I would have access to strong pain relief if required.  
I arrived at the ward and was shown to my room. The nurse then came into my room, gave me my name band and explained the procedure briefly. I’m not sure if they introduced themself to me as I can’t remember a name. I voiced my anxiety around the pain and my previous experience but was met with no support or reassurance. I found the nurse to be extremely rough when inserting the tablets for the termination. I was tense due to the fear of the unknown but they just kept telling me to relax, I apologised and said I have had a bad experience before that’s why I am tense but this was not acknowledged. All I needed was a few minutes to calm down but it seemed that the staff member did not have time for that or for me. Needless to say I was considerably upset and in significant pain following this. They left a painkiller and an anti sickness tablet on the bedside and left. Unfortunately, I was reduced to tears at this point. As the painkillers were not administered prior to the termination medication, I gained no benefit from them at all. When I buzzed for pain relief I was asked by the same nurse if my periods were normally this bad. I was in agony and felt like I was being questioned for this. After a few hours of pain with little relief from pain killers, I eventually managed to shut my eyes. I was exhausted. The nurse then came to tell me that I was being moved to the scanning room where I could sit and await discharge because they had lots of emergencies that day. I was still in a lot of pain and feeling sick. I packed up my things and a lovely student nurse helped me walk round to the room - there was a hard upright chair to sit on. I was not shown where a toilet was even though I was still heavily bleeding. By this stage I just wanted home to see my husband for support. Again, the student nurse made me a slice of toast whilst i waited. The original nurse from earlier came to see me, told me I had my discharge letter and I could go. I was given no advice on what is normal following a medical abortion and when and whom I should contact if I was concerned.  
I walked from the ward to my car in tears and in pain. I’m aware that compared to the other patients on the ward, I was not ‘acutely unwell’ and I am also aware that wards can be busy. However, I had a right to receive patient-centered compassionate care and unfortunately, I never received that. I felt rushed and to move me to a room with a hard chair and no toilet access when I was still in lots of pain was not good enough. As a nurse myself, I am aware that there can be barriers within nursing practice however being compassionate and taking the time to listen to your patients is fundamental practice within nursing. Unfortunately, on reflecting on my experience I wished I had stayed at home as it has made what was already a very traumatic and sensitive procedure even more upsetting for me.  
I wanted to give feedback as a health professional as I feel it’s important that staff can reflect on practice for the future and change it, so that no one else shares the same experience as I did.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: guidetx88
title: The new callback system is a farce
body: I called my GP several times and waited hour’s in-between for a call back which never happened. The GP receptionist then told me to go to ED. When I arrived in A&E I was then advised to call another number and a different doctor will call me back. This call back system is a farce and very frustrating when waiting hours to be called. Once the ED doctor called me back I was seen promptly in ED. I feel that Dungannon hospital needs their ED reinstated there is an obvious demand. I was then transferred to Trauma and all the staff are brilliant. I have a large family and miss having visitors. Talking on the phone is not the same. I am lucky to be in a side room but the TV is too small and needs repositioned. There is also a lack of remote controls for the TV’s. I feel like the nurses are pulling hens teeth trying to find a remote control when I ask. The T.V. is very high up and my remote does not switch it off so the nursing staff have to stand on a chair to turn it off which is putting themselves at risk.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: leomq36
title: Visiting rules should be relaxed
body: The wait times in ED are crazy and far to long for medical emergencies. The trolley beds are uncomfortable especially with a broken leg. I was then moved to trauma and the staff are great. The food sometimes has a skin on top and it just repulses me. I am looking forward to getting home to get a home cooked meal. If I could improve anything it would be the wait times to be seen in ED, the wait time to be moved from ED to a ward. I would also move the position of the TV as it is behind the door so view can be restricted.I would also allow family members who are double vaccinated and can provide a negative test to visit. I also don’t understand why the stay in ED is not included in the 1 week wait to see visitors. I have had a traumatic time and I would like to see my family and feel like I am being punished as I was in ED for 2 nights before being moved to the ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: leopardfw46
title: Being left in ED corridor
body: ED was very busy and I waited about 6 hours before being seen. I was then moved to the green bay and it was a nightmare. I was moved from a bay to a corridor beside triage. It was very busy, loud and I felt vulnerable as there were patients and staff constantly walking past me. I was in the corridor all night so didn’t get any sleep. The doctor was great and explained everything including what scans and tests I needed. I was very sick and had a sore tummy from vomiting so much and being left in the corridor was just mental torture. I was then moved to 1 south and I feel more secure. The meals are too much and a sandwich at lunch time would be sufficient. Individual fans or higher window openings would help stop arguments as the person beside the window feels the draught more than the person beside the corridor.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: scutumkn36
title: Staff were super knowledgeable
body:
I came in for my vaccines as front line social care staff.  
I had both vaccines. Staff were super knowledgeable, friendly and professional.  
Brilliant NHS experience.

author: phoenixgz78
title: Appointment
body: Always make you feel comfortable, and very caring. (Sasha & Tracey)

author: errandwp69
title: GP Failure
body:
I have been contacting my GP since December but I was told I had long Covid and prescribed antibiotics. The antibiotics never worked but due to the current pandemic and the media influence I assumed my GP was right.  
After months of not being able to sleep in bed and having constant SOB my wife called the GP and insisted I be seen in person instead of a telephone chat. The GP did a ECG and “blue lighted” me to CAH. The care provided in 1 North is perfect and the Doctors have prescribed me the appropriate medication as I can feel myself getting better. I am frustrated that my GP panned me off for months as I have since learnt I was suffering heart failure and not long Covid.  
Thankfully I have survived to tell the tale but it’s scary to think that I could have died due to my GP lack of personal appointments. A phone call is not sufficient to diagnose an illness. A&E for hours but cannot have an appointment in the GP surgery.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hydrustk99
title: Virtual call to my mother
body:
Virtual call to my mother  
Was nice to see and talk with my mother today who has been in hospital since last Sunday  
Very good experience  
Credit to Craigavon hospital and operator who set all this up today so quickly  
People complain about the NHS  
However this experience today was a very positive one and my mother is receiving excellent care in the orthopaedic ward  
Staff been excellent  
Let’s put out some positive thoughts in these difficult times  
Thanks NHS

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Thanksagain
title: Bike accident
body: Our teenage son was knocked off his bike on Christmas Eve 2018. On Christmas Day a surgeon at the John Radcliffe hospital operated on his elbow and inserted a rod. He is now free of pain, has full strength and movement back, loves climbing and surfing, and gets around everywhere by bike. We don’t remember the name of the surgeon but he had military experience (he said he had only seen that kind of damage in veterans). We would like to send heartfelt thanks to him and all the staff at the JR as well as their families for putting up with their absence at holiday time. We are so grateful for your care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Stretch59
title: Very professional
body: I had a colonoscopy at North Devon District Hospital. The staff were amazing. Very kind and caring, and explained everything fully. The only unpleasant part is the bowel prep you have to drink but I guess there’s no alternative at the moment. Overall the experience was very professional

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Iain1
title: Pacemaker Implant
body: I went in to have a pacemaker fitted in the day intervention Centre at the Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy. The staff were absolutely fantastic, they kept you informed at all times. The theatre staff were brilliant as well, the procedure was fully explained to me and they kept me updated with what they were doing as the procedure was carried out. All the staff also had a sense of humour so although, to be honest, hospital is the last place any of us would wish to be, they made it as relaxing as it possibly could be. I couldn't think of one thing that I could fall to them on or complain about.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: Wigwambam
title: Fracture Clinic
body:
I was surprised to be discharged from the fracture clinic 3 days post fracture with very little advice eg how to use the crutches or for how long. How long to use the boot. They did say to call them if I needed to but no advice as to what sort of thing I might call for. This is explained as patient led care. My problem is never having experienced a fracture before I don’t know what is normal or what level of pain/discomfort to expect.  
I am now 11 weeks post fracture still with some pain, swelling and inflammation when walking even a short distance. I don’t know if this is normal and don’t want to be a nuisance asking perhaps obvious questions (that aren’t obvious to me) because I saw how busy the staff. I think It would be very reassuring if there was some input even once or twice post fracture just to make sure things are progressing as they should be.

author: Iain1
title: The staff were all fantastic
body: I went in for a prostate biopsy in the Queen Margaret Hospital in Dunfermline. The staff were all fantastic, the procedure and what would be happening before, during, and after the procedure was fully explained to me when I went in. All the staff in the biopsy room were great, the two nurses kept chatting away to me to take my mind off what was happening. I couldn't complain about anything, the procedure was carried out and as far as I was concerned it was painless. Great staff, not one thing that I could fault them on or complain about. I even got two cups of coffee and biscuits before I left.

author: eden092
title: Staffing levels Eden ward Rampton
body: As a ward which is Eden Ward, we have been informed that we should run on 7 staff due to this being a big ward and hoses 14 patients at the minute.  But the last few months we have been running on 4 to 5 staff which then takes it to 3 and 4 during staff breaks.  This leaves the day area and other areas sometimes locked off, and we also don’t get fresh air as we should because of staffing.  We bring this up in meetings and get told by matrons and deputy matrons it will get sorted, then the next day they again take staff off us.  This is the last straw I can go down to be listened too and hoping some one listens.  I don’t feel safe some days.  Our activity coordinator for the ward gets taken into nursing numbers or moved to another ward so we don’t get our activities.  We get medication late, lunch and dinner late so its barely warm.  Ward atmosphere is not good.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: severityyt88
title: Building works
body: On the emergency surgical unit we were all woken up at 07:34 by someone drilling through a wall. I appreciate building works need to take place but this seems incredibly inconsiderate towards recovering patients and possibly against healthy safety regulations for staff. It sounded like a helicopter was crashing into the ward.

author: gammack84
title: More staff needed in waiting area
body: I was triaged quickly in ED but then had to wait 9 hours to be seen by doctors and nurses. The windows in ED are open due to Covid and it is very cold. The patients in ED waiting room are not checked on and a man collapsed in front of me in the waiting room which is frightening especially for the elderly patients waiting to be seen. The nurses in 4 north are great. I think the delay between tests and doctors could be improved. The meals are basic and not to my taste. The hospital is very busy and staff deserve a pay rise, increase staff numbers and shown more appreciation.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dawjq59
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My thanks and appreciation
body: I went to the GPs - Carrfield Medical Centre to see the practice nurse Nicky Kenyon. She explained everything she was doing in great detail. My husband was put totally at ease. I cannot express my thanks and appreciation enough.

title: Great practise nurse
body: The nurse that I seen was lovely and friendly. I felt comfortable with her and was happy with my experience

title: Incredible response, empathy and care
body:
Our son was found in the early morning passed out at bus stop in Marble Arch.  A Good Samaritan stopped, woke him, and recognising a need he called an ambulance, staying until it arrived.  The ambulance team were very caring and engaging, transporting him to hospital.  The welcome, testing and personal attention was excellent giving our son confidence he was in the best hands.  By noon the test results were back and having rehydrated he was allowed to discharge knowing what had happened.  
Not only was the whole experience incredibly positive, but very caring.
We would also like to know if the name of the Good Samaritan was saved in the hospital records.  His speedy action at the bus stop plus waiting there until the medics arrived will never be forgotten.  We would like to say thank you in person.  Can you help?

title: Flu vaccine
body:
Extremely efficient and friendly, very well organised.
Not much else to say apart from impressed and great full they are working on a Saturday

title: Excellent Practice
body: I have been registered with Tooting South Medical Centre for more than ten years. The service provided by them are excellent. Whenever I phoned the reception for an appointment and for other queries I was greeted and also treated well by the doctors. Receptionists are experienced, polite and very helpful. I received calls from Doctors without fail for telephone appointment  within the given time. I wish them to keep up their good service.

title: Impressive
body:
Flu jab very efficient and pleasant previously Covoid same experience 
Prescription services work well

title: Thank you Whittington hospital
body:
My partner were treated with such kindness and everyone made the effort to make us feel comfortable despite how busy they were

I am so greatly for all your help and support

title: Quick and efficient
body: My hudaband I recently had our flu jab it was really organised and we were in and out within minutes  good rotation of patients

title: quick & efficient
body: Always prompt to see me. Reception very good, drs effective and pleasant. Repeat prescriptions handled quickly. Overall very professional and friendly.

title: Amazing practice
body:
I have called and been booked a same day appointment, had a telephone call and then been booked to be seen on the same day. They are so very busy and I always manage to get the care.
Well done everyone at Clifton Road Surgery.

title: Super Efficient Service
body: Contacted the surgery about suspected symptoms of a serious nature and, despite my call being outside the timeframe for same-day appointments, was fast-tracked by the very helpful and understanding receptionist.  Within two hours of my initial call I was being examined by a kind and reassuring  doctor and in possession of a letter of referral for further investigation.  Just four weeks later I underwent major surgery and am now recovering at home and hopeful of a good outcome.  I am in no doubt that the quick response from both receptionist and doctor was crucial to my early diagnosis and treatment, for which they have my most grateful thanks.

title: Very good, prompt and friendly service
body: Have used eConsult twice, received call back next day both times. First time was to agree diagnosis, with GP, which turned out to be correct. GP friendly and very informative. Second time was to report treatment results and agree next steps. Clinical pharmacist also friendly and helpful, issued repeat prescription. A really good experience, and highly recommend the eConsult service if possible

title: Super quick response - efficient, patient and…
body:
I was worried about a small  dark 'blip' on my face which appeared last year and has grown thicker. I was given a phone appointment but the doctor converted this to a face to face visit. My appointment was on time and the doctor took a close look at the spot and assured me it was not cancerous (a 'solar lentigo' I think) . He advised me it could be treated and offered me a choice of cream or freezing which could be painful. I opted for the freezing and he immediately went and got the equipment and did it straight away.  (Not very painful but a burning sensation.) I was very impressed with the straightforward way I was dealt with, the explanation made, the choices I was given,  and the speed of action which meant I was out of the surgery within ten minutes of the appointment starting. With luck the blemish will vanish over the next few weeks.  
I felt incredibly reassured and well treated. So thank you. Patience, efficiency, care and treatment - all delivered on time and quickly.

title: Thank you
body: We would like to thank the nurses in the MIU for the help we've received when visiting the area. Our little boy tripped over and had a big cut on his forehead. We have been seen very quickly, in and out within half an hour. Very polite and professional care.

title: Cannot fault
body: Cannot fault this surgery, so efficient, so friendly, so organised. Perfect example of what all NHS service should be!

title: Reception team and some Doctors- great!
body:
I've always been treated very personable especially by the reception team!
Most doctors are great! As anywhere in the NHS they're very busy which can be frustrating- patience to patients! There's always 111 for more urgent matters. Give them a break!

title: Great Practice
body: Extremely helpful staff who are always polite and helpful.  The practice provides brilliant service, such as referrals etc.

title: Lovely GP Surgery
body:
My GP Surgery is such a great practice, they are friendly, supportive and do the best they can do for you, they take the time to get to know you and always ask if there is anything else you would like to discuss.
I have never felt uncomfortable or pressured best practice I’ve known

title: brilliant staff
body: came to get my copper iud fitted and had two very lovely and friendly members of staff who made me feel super comfortable the entire time. very glad i chose to come here!

title: Easy flu jab
body: In and out in under 2 minutes. Friendly staff. Grateful to have been able to get my jab so efficiently.

title: Sloan Medical Service Review
body:
Flu vaccine-brilliant and efficient service. I also felt safe, even in COVID times.
My elderly mum is also a patient. I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the Drs, nurses and receptionists who help me look after mum, and despite many medical conditions enable her to have independent living (with a lot of care support). They have also worked alongside me to minimise hospital stays. It is true to say it’s thanks to this practice and the care they give mum is still hanging in there. A credit to the NHS and other surgeries could learn from their compassion and expertise.

title: Great Staff
body: I would like to say the Telephone Reception staff are very kind, helpful and efficient. I've had to call for quite a few things recently and they've always been so kind.

title: Great Admin Team
body: I rang the surgery early this morning to find out how to change my married name to my maiden name on the NHS system so the details shown on my Covid Pass matched the ones on my passport. The lovely lady couldn’t guarantee how long this would take, however she told me what it was required.  I then went to the surgery with all my documentation, filled in a form and the attentive receptionist changed my personal details there and then. I logged on onto the NHS App an hour later and my records had changed together with the name shown on the Covid Pass. Thank you so much for the speedy service.

title: Caring Practice
body: Even throughout lockdown I have not felt ‘alone’ I have been able to reach my doctors by phone appointment and for the more serious concerns I have had face to face appointments. The last one being only weeks ago with the offer of another if the problem isn’t resolved. Reception are lovely and quick to act and the doctors are always determined to resolve health problems.

author: delphinusdq95
title: I contracted coronavirus
body: Five weeks ago i contracted coronavirus and my life has not been the same since. Please, if you have not taking the vaccine yet. I'm asking you to go for it don't think about it please. I have three children to be here for. I strongly believe the vaccine saved my life I'm very grateful to the NHS. My Doctor is being amazing with my recovery. Just want to say a big thank you to Dr Celia.

title: Excellent reception & experience
body: I was in severe pain and discomfort, all the nurses extremely busy and but very attentive , not only to me but to a number of stressed , difficult cases the kindness was demonstrated many times, over as a infrequent user of the National Health service we are “ blessed “ and need to value the highly competent medical personnel we need in times of trauma, bad health etc.

title: Great doctor and medical staff
body: Excellent phone consultation with a doctor and another member of medical staff, today. Both patient and reassuring and above all, kind.

title: Brilliant GP Practice
body: GPs friendly, interested and knowledgeable. Provide an excellent service. Currently most appointments are over the telephone. Very professional and helpful. Hoping soon there will be more 1 to 1 surgery appointments.

title: Great experience
body: Went to a flu jab drop in, it was run really efficiently, and most importantly, safely. I was in and out quickly.

title: The best care
body: I cant begin to express the gratitude myself & my partner have for all staff in the Paediatric department, the assessment ward, HDU & the ward 24. All the nurses (particularly in the HDU where we spent most of our stay with our young baby) were just fantastic. Not only in caring for our son but looking after us too while we went through a very stressful time. Thank you so much. You are all heroes. Please let me know how i can get a card to the staff on the HDU to thank them personally. Many thanks

title: Not answering phone
body: I phoned for my 90 year old neighbour as her phone call with a pharmacist for her condition was not appropriate. I waited 40 minutes and no answer so had to hang up with no help. Why are we hearing adverts to contact your GP surgery as they don't answer the phone so bit pointless! Don't even know who my Dr is!

title: Not a great service
body: What happened to the patient values that QEQM listed on their website. They are certainly not living up to it. My mum was recently transfer to the Quex ward following admittance from A&E. I get that the NHS is under a lot of pressure, but at all times they should remain professional, should they not??? - well when my sister spoke to the nurse on the ward to get an update about my mum's situation, he responded in a rude way saying 'are you a doctor'.....what was that all about. all he had to do was give my sister as much information as possible and say that he will find out more or try to find a doctor to explain rather than give incorrect information. It's only taken them a week to let us know what the doctors have decided to do. I mean each time we ask for an update we get given different information.....one minute they are saying that Mum can go home and then other saying they need run tests........just make up your mind.......you are playing with patients lives here. you are suppose to help them, care for them whilst in your hospital. How do you expect the public to trust you if you can't give consistent information. it's ridiculous

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Staff extremely unhelpful
body: I was at the surgery waiting for my appointment when an old frail lady came in and explained to the young girl on reception that she had been trying to ring for 2 days to get her husband an appointment as he needs to see a doctor but no one is answering, the receptionist told her their phones were working properly so the old lady asked if she make the appointment with her then but was told no it has to be done on the phone or on line the old lady looked confused and said ill go home and try again then would you listen out for me please she said to the receptionist my heart broke for this poor old lady as I have had my own difficulties with this practice some serious staff training is needed

title: Excellent surgery!
body: Annual flu vaccination went as smoothly as usual; no wait, barely sit down and you're done. Everyone very professional, polite but also friendly.

title: Wonderful thorough service
body: Exasperated and worried by continuing problems relating to a fall I went to A&E. The service I received was excellent. Thorough and comprehensive examination has got to the source of the problem and I'm being referred on for specialist treatment. What a relief! Thank you to all.

readBy.name: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant Service
body: I would like to thank the fantastic team in the Endoscopy Unit. The pre-op nurse was really friendly and reassuring. I was understandably anxious but she put me at ease with her lovely manner and helpful explanation of the procedure. It was also brilliant to see her again when I was in the recovery room, where she made sure I was ok and explained the report to me. Big thanks to her colleague who made me a cup of tea and biscuits. The team who carried out the procedure were also amazing. They were very professional but caring too. Thanks to the lovely nurse who chatted to me during the Endoscopy which helped enormously to help me relax. Surprisingly, I found watching on the screen to be helpful! Altogether everyone was very friendly and helpful. A real credit to the NHS.

title: Bad practice and very Rude doctor
body: The Doctor was very rude, speaking to my mum and me with no single eye contact and was speaking very quietly, no effective communication, lack of empathy, no caring attitude, i regret going there today. Worst day of my life

title: Good luck getting an appointment
body: I have been at this practice since I was a child and I cannot remember a time when it was easy to get an appointment, not only are there hardly any appointments, they never want you to book in advance and they have gatekeepers that are supposed to be receptionists there to specifically prevent you getting an appointment. They’re rude and abrupt asking far too many questions about patient health, they’re an untrained individual who should not be questioning the patient’s reasoning for calling to speak to a doctor. Just avoid this medical centre to save yourself a headache. Another problem I have found is the ever changing time to call in order to get an appointment it used to be twice a day now its once.

title: So unhelpful
body: If it's possible to contact the clinic, all the receptionist will say is, "Computer says 'no'". I'm the fool for returning to this place every couple of years hoping the clinic is working for its patients.

title: Poor service
body: This is the worst surgery I have ever been in touch. I have been trying to get a appointment for weeks now but everytime I call the lines busy or when I do get through their either full or told to call again even after explaining my problems and how long iv been calling only to be told from the very rude receptionists she doesn't care and call back again in the morning or go to walk-in center. Get more doctors in if you can't see all your patients and receptionists need to get off their high horses and treat patients kindly and not just be there for the wages .

title: Complete joke!
body: On hold from when the phone lines open at 8am for over half an hour, as soon as the phone is answered they say there's no appointments. Explained it's for a 9 month old baby and get told to wait till 6.30pm and call 111! Then get reminded that you have to call at 8am!.... I DID!

title: Reception need a update on what is…
body:
Ringing up for an appointment firstly is a nightmare, takes at least 30 minutes to get in touch with someone. Then you went all that time to be treated with a complete disrespectful manner. 

For instance, I spoke to a lovely receptionist the other day who told me to ring back to request a blood test, which I did this morning - to then be told by a rude receptionist “well I’m not sure what we can do about that but I’ll leave that to the doctor” really? I haven’t just waited 30 minutes to be spoken to out of term, I don’t expect you to know what to do about that, that’s why your the receptionist.

title: Trying to cancel an appointment
body: Spent an hour trying to cancel an appointment for today due to ilness, so someone else  could use my time slot. Gave up.

title: Brilliant practice nurse
body:
I visited the practice today for a smear test (never something which any woman looks forward to!). The nurse l saw was so friendly and put me at my ease straightaway. The test itself was one of the smoothest I've ever had and l think a large part of this was the approach of the nurse and her friendly nature. 
My experience of this practice in general is very positive, but l just wanted to highlight this particular area of great care and the impact it had on me.

title: Front of staff very rude
body:
Front of staff very rude and unhelpful. 

I could not fault the nurse, she was was so lovely and welcoming once I went into treatment room.

title: Most unpleasant practice
body: It's near impossible to book an appointment with a doctor, there is never any online appointments available using myGP as they have probably turned this off. You cannot get through on their telephone line to book an appointment and when you do you are told there are no appointments available and to call back again tomorrow. Generally a very poor attitude towards patients by all members of staff, it seems like an embedded culture here at the practice.

title: Worst practice ever.
body: These people are the rudest I’ve ever encountered. They tell you to call at 8.15 for abs appointment- their lines are constantly engaged! When it does ring they don’t answer! I’m in terrible pain right now and can’t get any help whatsoever - it’s a disgrace! Someone need to do something about them!!!

title: Exemplar for General Practice
body: The medical and support team at Wellfield Surgery are the embodiment of what an ideal general practice should be. The quality of care provided to my 93 year old mother (often liaising with me - I am geographically distant) over many years has been of the highest standard.   My mother and I (and many other family members) have supreme confidence in the quality of healthcare provided by the team at Wellfield. Our experience has been that such care has been of a consistently high standard throughout and that it is personal, effective and safe.  Notwithstanding my mother’s mature years, she has been treated not only with respect and compassion but also with dignity.

title: Really friendly
body: Went for Covid booster last week at Santos Pharmacy in Stroud Green Road, London N4. Very friendly atmosphere, everyone working to make patients feel relaxed and at ease. Information sheet explained.

title: Great Practice
body: My experience over the last 18 months with the surgery has been brilliant, from the Receptionists to the Doctors  in this very difficult time with Coronavirus. I have needed to contact on several occasions and cannot praise all of the staff enough, so kind and understanding and extremely helpful .Telephone consultations with Doctors and even face to face appointment when deemed neccessary. Thank you Westgate

title: Extremely efficient
body: Another very efficient service for getting my flu jab. Sloan Practice have their systems sorted - thank you 👍

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: It is incredibly difficult to get an appointment. On the NHS app it says there are "no appointments available to book at this time". On their website it says to use the "convenient" econsult system but when you click the link it says "the online consultation system platform is currently unavailable" and it has said this since yesterday. When you phone them, it also says to use the econsult system so I chose the extension for general enquiries as there are no better options. I was on hold for over 20 minutes and was told that I should have completed an econsult between 7-9 am. It doesn't say you have to do it at any specific time on the website so I woke up and tried literally just after 9 but had already missed the opportunity to get an appointment till i do an econsult at 7am tomorrow. This would be more manageable if I wasn't really, really ill while trying to sort this out. The receptionist was very nice and gave me useful advice but this doesn't change the fact that It is much too difficult to make an appointment. I will now have to go to a walk in centre as I need to be seen by a doctor today.

title: Very efficient
body: I called, on speck, at the Council Offices, Loughborough to see if I could possibly received my 3rd/booster COVID Injection. As soon as I showed my vaccination card to confirm that I had received my 2nd injection 6 months prior I was escorted into the building. My waiting time was minutes only before I received my injection. After the usual waiting time was up I was checked to see that I was ok and then allowed to leave the building, the whole procedure having taken less than half an hour. The were both friendly and efficient.

title: Dedicated Gp
body: I completed an e-consult to the practice at 5.15pm on Friday 29/10/21 I was contacted by the Gp at 18.40pm on the same day and a hospital referral was made. I am extremely grateful to the Gp for his dedication and diligence, a true professional.

title: Wonderful care and attention
body: I had the misfortune to fracture my hip and need a partial replacement. The care I received from the paramedics right through to the occupational health and physio team was outstanding. I would like to thank each and everyone of the team who are just a delight. Kind , compassionate, caring, patient  all of these things in abundance. when one is feeling vulnerable that is exactly what is needed.  The staff on ward 25b you are A1 Thank you. Bless you all. We are lucky to have such a wonderful hospital on our doorstep.

title: Excellent Practice
body: I've always found them very helpful and accommodating. My family have been with them for many years. Thanks

title: Outstanding Practice
body: I have been visiting this practice for some considerable time now and the service provided by them in all the areas that I have encountered has been outstanding. Over the last month I have had several contacts for various health issues both online and in person. The service provided by all from the reception to health assistant to doctor has been of the highest quality with no delays whatsoever. I therefore cannot recommend them highly enough. In a previous employment I visited surgeries throughout Warwickshire and Coventry so have a fair idea of the standards at GPs and St Wulfstans excels in all areas. This practice should be the standard role model that others should achieve. Personally I do not think if I was a private patient that I would get better service anywhere. A 5 star service.

title: Skull Base Surgery
body:
I am under the care of a fantastic surgeon who is a specialist in his field of head and neck cancers. I had skull base surgery; from the receptionist who calls to confirm arrangements amongst other support staff, from the admissions team, the surgical team, recovery and EPAC team were absolutely faultless in the support, care, empathy shown towards me. Words cannot express my absolute gratitude towards each and every one of them involved in the removal of my head cancer and subsequent aftercare. I would also like to pay special thanks to another consultant who saw me daily and did another procedure to plug a CSF leak successfully.
The hospital is huge, and often can expect problems to develop but this part of my treatment functioned like clockwork, I had an issue a week into my stay on the ward but that is reported seperately and does not form part of this review. Thank you QE.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Sloan Practice
body: I have visited recently for both a blood test and the flu vaccine. On both occasions the staff were friendly and efficient, ensuring that the visit was stress free.
